channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here’s Why Stormy Daniels Was Ordered to Pay Trump in 2018
item.description: Stormy Daniels sued Donald J. Trump for defamation and lost. Her lawyer wound up in prison for stealing from her.

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Tanks Enter Rafah and Take Control of Border Crossing
item.description: A military official said the scope of the operation was limited and aimed at destroying Hamas targets. The United Nations warned that the crossing’s closure could worsen the humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

item.title: U.S. investigators ask Tesla why there have been 20 crashes since carmaker supposedly fixed Autopilot flaws
item.description: "Tesla tried to do the least possible remedy to see what they could get away with,” one observer said.

item.title: A Disability Arts Group, Creative Growth, Makes History at SFMOMA
item.description: After 50 years, Creative Growth in Oakland celebrates as its artists enter the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art’s collection.

item.title: U.K. Armed Forces’ Data Exposed in Hostile Cyberattack
item.description: A payroll system used by Britain’s Ministry of Defense was targeted in a cyberattack that some lawmakers alleged was orchestrated by China.

item.title: Boy Scouts no more: Organization changes name to Scouting America as it exits bankruptcy after storm of controversy
item.description: The organization began allowing gay youth in 2013 and ended a blanket ban on gay adult leaders in 2015, and a few years later, announced that girls would be accepted as Cub Scouts.

item.title: Kristi Noem’s Book: Four Takeaways
item.description: After a rough start to the rollout of her memoir, the South Dakota governor has continued to defend shooting her dog and to deflect on a false story about meeting Kim Jong-un.

item.title: Gaza War Puts New Pressures on Biden’s Arms Transfer Policies
item.description: The Biden administration is due to release a report this week on whether it believes assurances from Israel on its use of U.S. arms and protection of civilians.

item.title: Biden condemns antisemitism, says people are forgetting that ‘Hamas unleashed this terror’
item.description: In remarks at the Capitol, Biden said that on Oct. 7, Hamas "brought to life" this type of hatred with the killing of more than 1,200 Israelis, mostly civilians.

item.title: The One Thing Trump Knows He Wants in a Running Mate
item.description: When election denialism is a prerequisite.

item.title: U.S. Soldier Is Detained in Russia and Accused of Theft, Officials Say
item.description: The American soldier was detained last week. He was traveling home after being stationed in South Korea, according to the U.S. authorities.

item.title: We ranked the best cash back cards available in 2024
item.description: These cash back credit cards can put hundreds of dollars back in your pocket.

item.title: Gaza War Puts New Pressures on Biden’s Arms Transfer Policies
item.description: The Biden administration is due to release a report this week on whether it believes assurances from Israel on its use of U.S. arms and protection of civilians.

item.title: Blinken Holds Regional Talks on Migration in Latin America
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken’s trip to Guatemala comes as the United States tries to get countries in the region to ramp up enforcement of their borders.

item.title: New York governor regrets saying ‘we have young Black kids growing up in the Bronx who don’t even know what the word computer is’
item.description: Assemblywoman Amanda Septimo, a Bronx Democrat, who said the remark was “harmful, deeply misinformed, and genuinely appalling.”
